alert.note: Alert for Northern Franklin; Southern Franklin; Western Clinton (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 1:48PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Clinton and northeastern Franklin Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 148 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bryants Mill, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Malone, Burke, Debar Mountain, Merrill, Bryants Mill, Chateaugay, Lyon Mountain, Earlville, Chazy Lake, Whippleville, Duane Center, Burke Center, Ellenburg Mountain, Harrigan, Ellenburg Center, Owls Head, Chasm Falls, Standish, Brainardsville, and Wolf Pond. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northern New York.

area.areaDesc: Northern Franklin; Southern Franklin; Western Clinton
